title: How to Make a Cake Ribbon Bow Topper

steps.headline: Cut two pieces of the 5cm/2-inch-wide ribbon.
steps.description: Cut into lengths of 30cm/12 inches each.

steps.headline: Cut a V shape into each of the ribbon ends.
steps.description: This will prevent fraying and is a nice finishing edge.

steps.headline: Cut a small piece for wrapping around the center of the bow.
Cross the two ribbons in the middle.
steps.description: Glue together with just a dab of hot glue where they intersect.

steps.headline: Lay the 2.5cm/1-inch ribbon on top of the other ribbon.
steps.description: Form a double-looped bow from this piece and glue in place.

steps.headline: Wrap the small piece of the 5cm/2-inch-wide ribbon around the center of the double looped bow.
steps.description: Glue in place; this covers the hot gluing of the double bow and makes the bow seem seamless.

steps.headline: Glue the double looped bow to the two bottom crossed ribbons.
Place on top of the cake when fully dried.
steps.description: The bow can be attached to the cake using icing or frosting as "glue".

text: Preparing the Wider Ribbon Cut two pieces of the 5cm/2-inch-wide ribbon. Cut into lengths of 30cm/12 inches each. Cut a V shape into each of the ribbon ends. This will prevent fraying and is a nice finishing edge. Cut a small piece for wrapping around the center of the bow.  Assembling the Ribbon Bow Topper Cross the two ribbons in the middle. Glue together with just a dab of hot glue where they intersect. Lay the 2.5cm/1-inch ribbon on top of the other ribbon. Form a double-looped bow from this piece and glue in place. Wrap the small piece of the 5cm/2-inch-wide ribbon around the center of the double looped bow. Glue in place; this covers the hot gluing of the double bow and makes the bow seem seamless. Glue the double looped bow to the two bottom crossed ribbons. Allow to dry. Place on top of the cake when fully dried. The bow can be attached to the cake using icing or frosting as "glue".
